oai_dc:dc.dc:description: What a Maiden must eat and avoid (L II.-28. 2520-2524). How a New Maiden is treated, has been told in the Katkop dialect, by !kweiten ta ||ken (L VI.-2. 3997-4003); who also narrates the use made by Bushman Maidens of a kind of red stone (L VI.-1. 3970-3974). Maidens paint and adorn young men so that the rain and its lightning will not harm them out on the hunting-ground. 1) The page numbers in this book (VI-1) are duplicates of those in notebook IV-4, 2) See also About maidens and how they adorn young men with |ka or rooi klip, 3) This story is found in Book VI-1.
